intro: Deyeuxia aleutica, commonly known as the Aleutian wiregrass, is a perennial grass native to the northern regions of North America. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and alpine environments. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear minute grains. It plays a role in stabilizing soil in its harsh habitat and is adapted to cold climates. Deyeuxia aleutica is a hardy species that contributes to the ecological diversity of its native regions.
